metadata.title: CVE-2016-5404 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The cert_revoke command in FreeIPA does not check for the "revokecertificate" permission, which allows remote authenticated users to revokearbitrary certificates by leveraging the "retrieve certificate" permission.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5404` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeipa-admintools - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
freeipa-client - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
freeipa-common - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
freeipa-server - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
freeipa-server-dns - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
freeipa-server-trust-ad - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
freeipa-tests - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
python-ipaclient - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
python-ipalib - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
python-ipaserver - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
python-ipatests - 4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeipa package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.3-3ubuntu2.1').
